properties.Name: AssetAmortization
properties.Description:
A gradual reduction of intangible assets value over time, which is valued as of a period.

Amortization is a deductible expense allowed as a means of spreading the cost of an intangible asset over a period of years. 

Intangible Assets with a limited life are written down using straight-line depreciation over a period of time not to exceed 40 years.

The amortization entry to the accounting system is a debit amortization expense and a credit intangible asset.

Columns.Name: AssetId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Asset.

Columns.Name: AmortizationPeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date for which the amortization is determined.

Columns.Name: AmortizationPeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date for which the amortization is determined.

Columns.Name: AmortizationPeriod
Columns.Description: The number of years used to amortize the asset.

Columns.Name: PeriodAmortizationAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of amortization calculated for the associated period.

Properties.Description:
A gradual reduction of intangible assets value over time, which is valued as of a period.

Amortization is a deductible expense allowed as a means of spreading the cost of an intangible asset over a period of years. 

Intangible Assets with a limited life are written down using straight-line depreciation over a period of time not to exceed 40 years.

The amortization entry to the accounting system is a debit amortization expense and a credit intangible asset.
